thread.title: New youth justice centre for Victoria to be built in Werribee South
thread.title_full: New youth justice centre for Victoria to be built in Werribee South

title: New youth justice centre for Victoria to be built in Werribee South
text:
New youth justice centre for Victoria to be built in Werribee South Posted February 06, 2017 09:25:27 Map: Melbourne 3000 
The Victorian Government will build a new high security prison to house 224 young offenders in Werribee South, Premier Daniel Andrews has announced. 
Mr Andrews said a "damning" independent report into an existing youth justice centre at Parkville confirmed the need for the new $228 million facility. 
The review, which looked at riots at the Parkville centre last year, found it was not suitable for its intended purpose, with an unacceptable risk to staff and young inmates. 
"The Comrie report, which provides a very damning commentary on the state of Parkville, talks about the fact that if a facility is not secure, then no rehabilitation, no effective programs can be run in that facility," Mr Andrews said. 
"So it is critically important that we build a new youth justice facility." 
The state's youth detention centres have had widespread problems in recent months, including a mass break-out from the Malmsbury facility. 
More to come.
